thread.title: N.C. Woman Awarded $100,000 in Bed Bug Suit
thread.title_full: N.C. Woman Awarded $100,000 in Bed Bug Suit

title: N.C. Woman Awarded $100,000 in Bed Bug Suit
text: Subscribe N.C. Woman Awarded $100,000 in Bed Bug Suit A jury awarded a six-figure settlement to a Winston-Salem woman who filed a lawsuit against hotel giant Red Roof Inn after she said she suffered injuries from bed bugs at one of their properties in Prince George’s County, the Washington Post reported. October 9, 2015 A jury awarded a six-figure settlement to a Winston-Salem woman who filed a lawsuit against hotel giant Red Roof Inn after she said she suffered injuries from bedbugs at one of their properties in Prince George’s County, the Washington Post reported. Stacey Belle said she stayed for one night in January 2014 at one of the chain’s hotels in the 6100 block of Oxon Hill Road. She woke up itching. When she turned on her lights, she saw welts covering her arms and hands, lifted her pillow and found bedbugs crawling. In the lawsuit, Belle claimed that the Oxon Hill motel had previously found bedbugs in guest rooms and treated infestations. But the hotel did not check that Belle’s room was free of bedbugs before it rented it out to her, the lawsuit claimed. The jury awarded Belle $100,000 as compensation for her bites and subsequent distress. Click here to read the entire article.
